item.title: Lack of routine street cleaning and unmanaged waste on Commercial Road (Enfield-managed section), 26th February
item.description:
This report concerns an ongoing failure of routine street cleaning on the Enfield-managed section of Commercial Road, combined with unmanaged waste linked to commercial activity. Large amounts of litter and debris regularly accumulate along this stretch, including cardboard, pallets, general rubbish, and discarded nitrous oxide canisters. The waste remains in place for extended periods and continues to build up, creating an unsightly and unhygienic environment for residents and pedestrians. While businesses are responsible for managing the waste they generate and maintaining their immediate frontages, they are not responsible for general littering or fly-tipping by members of the public. The lack of routine street cleaning means that both commercial waste and general litter are being left to accumulate, compounding the problem. There is no visible presence of manual street cleansing operatives on this section of the road. As a result, waste that should be routinely cleared remains in place, spreads across pavements and into the carriageway, and attracts further dumping. The combined impact of unmanaged commercial waste and insufficient council street cleansing is significantly affecting the appearance of the area and residents’ quality of life, while also creating additional avoidable demand on council resources. This area requires: • Regular manual street sweeping • Improved monitoring and cleansing frequency • Engagement with local businesses regarding waste management and frontage standards • Enforcement where necessary to prevent repeat issues Without consistent street cleaning and enforcement, the condition of this section of Commercial Road will continue to deteriorate.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Commercial Road, Edmonton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole adjecent to traffic islan, 26th February
item.description:
This pothole is on Victoria Rd N9 northbound at a traffic island just after the junction with Chalfont Rd and just before the Hyde Arms pub. The pothole has been there for 4 weeks with no marking around it or any attempt to repair it. It is unavoidableand dangerous to all road users as it's near a traffic island and will damage motor vehicles and bicycles.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Chalfont Road, Edmonton
Report on FixMyStreet
